sn40.9:4.1: “‘They speak of this thing called the “signless heart samādhi”.
sn40.9:4.2: What is the signless heart samādhi?’
sn40.9:4.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless samādhi of the heart.
sn40.9:4.5: This is called the signless heart samādhi.’
sn40.9:4.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the signless samādhi of the heart.
sn40.9:4.7: While I was in that meditation, my consciousness followed after signs.
sn40.9:5.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic powers and said:
sn40.9:5.3: Don’t neglect the signless heart samādhi, brahmin! Settle your mind in the signless heart samādhi; unify your mind and bring it to samādhi in the signless heart samādhi.’
sn40.9:5.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the signless samādhi of the heart.
sn40.9:5.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.9:5.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
